biography.bio: Peng Tien was born in 1945 in Tsingtao, China as Tien Chien Chung. He is an actor and director, known for The Tongfather (1974), The 18 Bronzemen (1976) and Jade Dagger Ninja (1982).
biography.name: Peng Tien

biography.bio: Ho Tien is an actor and production manager, known for Jade Dagger Ninja (1982), The Tongfather (1974) and Duo qing shuang dao huan (1979).
biography.name: Ho Tien

biography.bio: Hua Chung was born on April 2, 1944 in Shandong, China. He is an actor and director, known for The 14 Amazons (1972), Bai Ma Su che gou hun fan (1979) and Les huit hommes de Shaolin (1978).
biography.name: Hua Chung

biography.bio: Chung-Erh Lung was born in 1957. She is an actress, known for Le protecteur (1978), Shaolin Wooden Men (1976) and Master of the Flying Guillotine (1976).
biography.name: Chung-Erh Lung

biography.bio: Ya-Lei Kuei was born on June 2, 1944 in Changsha City, Hunan Province, China as Yalei Gui. She is known for her work on The Wedding Banquet (1993), Miracles - Mr. Canton and Lady Rose (1989) and Eat Drink Man Woman (1994).
biography.name: Ya-Lei Kuei

biography.bio: Prior to being known as an established female star in Hong Kong action films, Taipei raised Yen Nan Hsi was known as Yen Ju-Ju who at age 17 on contract with Union Film Company was hailed in the Asia Film Festival as the most promising new actress in the little seen independent melodrama 'Tears of the Lover' in 1966. Nancy got her first big break when she was scouted by director/producer Joseph Kuo who signed her on for an open contract with his Hong Hwa Film studio where Nancy got her break with Kuo's 'Triangular Duel' which was enjoyed by moviegoers in Hong Kong and beyond. Around the same time, Nancy also acted opposite Taiwan industry colleagues Jimmy Wang Yu, Yusuaki Kurata, Chang Yi, Chen Sing and Tien Peng where she also got a chance to put her spunky athleticism into display in such films as 'Chaochow Guy', 'Ma Su Chen', 'The File of Heroes' and 'Black Panther' all giving her box office exposure at an early age. International exposure was the inevitable next step for Nancy where she gravitated into the high-flying world of the Hong Kong film industry where she did a series of high profile titles for Run Run Shaw but it was destined that Nancy would return to her roots in Taiwan where she gained her greatest international exposure after being cast in Joseph Kuo's popular 'Seven Grandmasters', a perennial cult favorite among kung fu aficionados across the globe.
biography.name: Nancy Yen

biography.bio: Jing Bei is an actor, known for Jade Dagger Ninja (1982).
biography.name: Jing Bei

biography.bio: Peng-Cheng Chang is a production manager and producer, known for Dao hun (1977), Hero of Shanghai (1977) and Dragon of the Swords Man (1978).
biography.name: Peng-Cheng Chang

biography.bio: Chin Hai Chen is an actor, known for Born invincible (1978), Master of the Flying Guillotine (1976) and 5 Masters of Death (1974).
biography.name: Chin Hai Chen

biography.bio: Liang Hsieh Chen is an actor, known for Jade Dagger Ninja (1982), The Dream Sword (1979) and Everlasting Chivalry (1980).
biography.name: Liang Hsieh Chen

biography.bio: Mu Chuan Chen is known for his work on Jin yi wei (1979), Bloody Monkey Master (1977) and Le Kid face au Lama (1980).
biography.name: Mu Chuan Chen

biography.bio: Ching-Hsia Chiang is an actress and production manager, known for Revenge of the Shaolin Kid (1978), Wu fung chao yang (1971) and Shen long fei xia (1968).
biography.name: Ching-Hsia Chiang

biography.bio: Kang Chin was born on August 26, 1939 in Taiwan. He is known for his work on Master of the Flying Guillotine (1976), Shaolin Wooden Men (1976) and Salut Bruce Lee, bonjour le tigre (1976).
biography.name: Kang Chin

biography.bio: Meng Chin was born in 1948 in China as Ling Lei. She is an actress, known for Xue zhong lian (1978), Ghost Under the Cold Moonlight (1975) and Qiu deng ye yu (1974). She has been married to Yeh Tien since 1973.
biography.name: Meng Chin

biography.bio: Chien-Lung Hsiao is an actor, known for Jade Dagger Ninja (1982), Little Hero (1978) and Ying xiong you lei (1979).
biography.name: Chien-Lung Hsiao
